My legal name is Zeyu Li, you can also call me **Tina**. I'm a master's student at Bloomberg School of Public Health, Johns Hopkins University. I'm from China. My research interests focus on **maternal and child health**. I am still exploring my interests and open to all opportunities, so if you are conducting related research and looking for a teammate, please contact me.

[**RESEARCH INTERESTS & SKILLS**]{.underline}

**Areas of interest**: Maternal and child health, early life origins of diseases, environmental and nutritional factors in early life, genetic and epigenetic epidemiological studies, and design and analysis of cohort studies.

**Skills**: Proficient in R, Stata, and SPSS. Familiar with frequently used statistical models such as Bayesian kernel machine regression (BKMR), Causal mediation analysis, multiple logistic regression, generalized linear models (GLMs), and generalized additive models (GAMs).
